body: How are you making your request into an HTTP/2.0 one? The default protocol version in http/client is 1.1.

I bypassed this by changing $request->getProtocolVersion() into CURL_HTTP_VERSION_2TLS in Curl.php line 75. If I don't do that the error shows:

Got some feedback from my hosting about overnight update:

Nov 20 21:48:47 Updated: ea-libcurl-7.67.0-1.1.2.cpanel.x86_64
Nov 20 21:49:17 Updated: ea-php70-php-curl-7.0.33-10.10.4.cpanel.x86_64
Nov 20 21:49:18 Updated: ea-php72-php-curl-7.2.24-1.1.3.cpanel.x86_64
Nov 20 21:49:18 Updated: ea-php56-php-curl-5.6.40-9.9.4.cpanel.x86_64
Nov 20 21:49:18 Updated: ea-php71-php-curl-7.1.33-1.1.3.cpanel.x86_64
So is the problem that you've been making HTTP/1.1 calls to an HTTP/2.0 service that is no longer willing to downgrade?

> So is the problem that you've been making HTTP/1.1 calls to an HTTP/2.0 service that is no longer willing to downgrade?

I think they are saying with `SERVER_VERSION` env variable set to `HTTP/2.0` they expect `ServerRequest::getProtocolVersion()` to override the 1.1 default with 2.0.

But the SERVER_VERSION environment variable is set by the web server running a cake application and represents the incoming http protocol version. That environment variable doesn't and shouldn't control outbound connections.

I did was expecting the SERVER_VERSION to override the 1.1 protocol. 

The problem occured only when I was sending the 1.1 with my Curl request and not with the 2.0 parameter. But Cakephp always sends 1.1 with their Curl request while CURL_HTTP_VERSION_2TLS  fallsback tot 1.1 when it's non SSL

If no assumption should be made, why is the Curl request making one? 

CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => $request->getProtocolVersion(), : line 75
It's not making assumptions, that method will try to use the version that the request object provides, and the request object has a static default.
@frent Can you provide a short code example of how you are sending the request?

>  But should the HTTP version be sent along with the CURL request then?

It should. We don't currently have a good way to set the default protocol a client is using. This is an oversight that hasn't come up until now. Would something like:

```php
$client = new Client(['protocolVersion' => '2.0'])
```
Be a reasonable approach? We would also need to conditionally use the new `CURL_HTTP_VERSION_2TLS` if it is defined.

Perhaps also the option to disable sending the protocolVersion at all with the Curl request. But yes I do believe that giving the option to decide what version you are going to use should be implemented. 

According to https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION.html a next version is being put in place with CURL_HTTP_VERSION_3 - with no fallback.

Any Curl option can be overwritten with `'curl' => [CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_2TLS]` in `$options` of `Client` constructor or get/post/put/patch/delete().

Generic non-adapter specific option would be better however.

It's a little unfortunately how deep you have to dig to find the default.

I think an app config that sets the default would work. You could set it to null to not enforce I suppose.

I don't think an Application configuration would work. You could make requests to different services that require different protocol versions.

Not sending a protocol version doesn't match up well with how the psr7 abstractions are meant to work.
I meant to set a default other than 1.1 -- the constructor options are best for what you describe.

issue.title: Improve support for HTTP/2 in Http\Client

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Add `protocolVersion` as a constructor option. Previously making HTTP/2 requests was tedious and not exposing this option earlier was an oversight.

Add support for HTTP2 requiring TLS. This mode is preferred over HTTP2 without TLS as most clients and server implementations require TLS for HTTP2.

Fixes #13922
